steps.title: Create Influence Event
steps.content: Click to add an influence event. (You can use the ← and → arrow keys to navigate the Tour!)

steps.title: Edit Influence Event
steps.content:
Hover an existing influence event to access Reveal/Hide, Edit and Remove functionality.
Click to enter the influence event.

steps.title: Influence Statistics
steps.content:
A timelimit is optionally shown for the event.
The influence challenge presents two statistics the party's attempts are typically compared against, perception and will.
It also details the premise of the influence event.

steps.title: Toolbar
steps.content: Start Event: This will open up this influence window for all online players so you can run it. Edit Event: This toggles you into edit mode to setup your influence event. Macro: The third icon copies a macro you can use to open this event.

steps.title: Discovery
steps.content:
The suggested skills used by players to learn about influence skills, weaknesses, resistances and penalties.
The GM can click these to hide/reveal them to players.

steps.title: Influence Skills
steps.content:
The suggested influence skills used to gain influence points in the event. The GM can click these to hide/reveal them to players.
The DC's are influenced by any weaknesses, resistances or penalties the GM has activated.

steps.title: Influence
steps.content:
The current influence points earned during the event. Here is where the GM can present the gradual results of the players efforts.
These can be revealed manually by clicking, or optionally set to auto reveal as the influence points reach the required total.
Influence Points can be raised and lowered using the ↑ and ↓ arrows.

steps.title: Weaknesses
steps.content:
Any potential weaknesses inherent to the event. The GM can click these to hide/reveal them to players.
Clicking the right modifier section will lower the DC of all Influence Skill checks for players while it's active.

steps.title: Resistances
steps.content:
Any potential resistances inherent to the event. The GM can click these to hide/reveal them to players.
Clicking the right modifier section will raise the DC of all Influence Skill checks for players while it's active.

steps.title: Penalties
steps.content:
Any potential penalties inherent to the event. The GM can click these to hide/reveal them to players.
Clicking the optional right modifier section will raise the DC of all Influence Skill checks for players while it's active.

tour-event.name: Crazed Inventor
tour-event.premise: You've stumbled into the magnificent, yet crazily dangerous workshop of Jikki Tabla the inventor. He could quite possibly help you on your journey, but he seems passingly interested in you at best as he continues his work while moving around you as if you were furniture.

1.description: The Inventor lets you buy and sell things from him. He says it's scrap, but it's great stuff.

2.description: Tikki Tabla is open to making custom design items for you. It's interesting for him aswell!

3.description: The Inventor gains an interest in your task and is willing to help you make a vehicle for the trip.

1.description: Hot stuff. Tikki Tabla swears the brain runs on chili. Giving him something really spicy lowers influence DCs by 2.
He hates sentient 'robots'. Any constructs, androids or other appicable ancestries or used items will increase influence DCs by 2.
You break it, you buy it. Any critical failures working with his things incurs a monetary cost. If not payed, he will start up the Doomsday Shredder(TM) against them in a chase!
